content.description: Fun problem on water shaped grooves and pockets. It's the Middle route on the higher part of the backside of the Fat Bastard boulder.
content.location: Start down low on jugs to the left of Fat Bastard's Thong...a sit start is optional and doesn't add much. The start is directly in front of the large tree. Getting down off the top is tricky so check it out first.

content.description: The route starts by Turtle Head and traverses up and to the left over the small roof and then left of the arete. The ramp to the left is off. Fun route and great warm-up or for laps.
content.location: In between Turtle Head and the down climb ramp on the backside of the Fat Bastard Boulder. Check out the top out before you climb as getting off the top is a little tricky.

content.description: Start just left of the crack on the backside of the Fat Bastard boulder. Start on jugs and work the edge of the crack up to the slab. Mantel and top out. Getting down is tricky.
content.location: Far-right route on the back of the Fat Bastard boulder.

content.description: Start about 10 feet to the left of Fat Bastard on the corner. Traverse to the right on poor feet and crimps to top out on Fat Bastard.
content.location: Starts 10 feet to the left of Fat Bastard.

content.description: Start on the ledge to the left of the downclimb ramp on the Fat Bastard boulder and go straight up on pinches and edges with tons of feet.
content.location: In the center of the boulder to the left of the downclimb ramp.

content.description: Sit start just around the corner to the left of Baby Back Ribs. Work the arete and edge up. Really fun holds.
content.location: To the left around the corner from Baby Back Ribs.

content.description: Sit start on a rail to the left of the Fat Bastard Traverse on the slab below the small roof. Pull up onto the slab, then mantle using jugs over the roof.
content.location: To the left of the Fat Bastard Traverse.

content.description: A large boulder with lots of easy warm-up problems and really cool texture/holds. The rock looks like a bluish-grey sandstone...smooth water-worn features and rounded cracks and pockets abound.
